page.title: 04HOUSES IN PETROCKSTOWE cont.
page.content: in small development groupings in the centre of the village - the only area served by a{main sewer. }These devel- opments took place in 1968-1971 and 1981. Modern bungalows generally have a single living room and two or three bedrooms, and cottages follow the same arrangement. Houses either are, or were, farmhouses and generally have at least three living rooms. All the homes have{mains electricity,}and with only one or two exceptions all have {mains water.} 75% are connected to the {telephone system. }Mains gas is not available in the area. All resi- dential properties have a bathroom and inside lavatory. Most people cook by electricity or solid fuel, which also serves to heat water and some central heating. In the event of a major power failure the community would virtually grind to a halt.
